input_str:
Are you wondering why the Indian police hold hands with alleged criminals instead of snapping handcuffs on them? From the four men arrested for the 2012 New Delhi bus gang rape, to the three men taken into police custody Sunday for allegedly harassing two women -- also on a bus -- in the northern state of Haryana, it is common to see the police hand in hand with criminal suspects in India.

Here’s why: Indian law says the police must touch a suspect. When making an arrest, a police officer “shall actually
